intro: Hieracium eriosphaera, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems, which give it its common name. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hieracium eriosphaera is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
